translations.english: The work of a person who is unattached, who is liberated, whose mind is established in knowledge, and who acts only for the sake of sacrifice (Yajña), dissolves completely.

verses.original:
ब्रह्मार्पणं ब्रह्म हविर्ब्रह्माग्नौ ब्रह्मणा हुतम् ।
ब्रह्मैव तेन गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मकर्मसमाधिना ॥ २४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
brahmārpaṇaṁ brahma havir brahmāgnau brahmaṇā hutam |
brahmaiva tena gantavyaṁ brahma-karma-samādhinā || 24 ||

translations.english: The process of offering is Brahman (the Supreme Spirit), the oblation is Brahman, the offering is made by Brahman into the fire of Brahman. Brahman alone is to be reached by one who is absorbed in action that is Brahman.

verses.original:
दैवमेवापरे यज्ञं योगिनः पर्युपासते ।
ब्रह्माग्नावपरे यज्ञं यज्ञेनैवोपजुह्वति ॥ २५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
daivam evāpare yajñaṁ yoginaḥ paryupāsate |
brahmāgnāv apare yajñaṁ yajñenaivopajuhvati || 25 ||

translations.english: Some yogis worship the celestial gods with various sacrifices, while others offer the self as a sacrifice into the fire of the Supreme Spirit (Brahman) by means of sacrifice itself.

verses.original:
श्रोत्रादीनीन्द्रियाण्यन्ये संयमाग्निषु जुह्वति ।
शब्दादीन्विषयानन्य इन्द्रियाग्निषु जुह्वति ॥ २६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śrotrādīnīndriyāṇyanye saṁyamāgniṣhu juhvati |
śhabdādīn viṣhayān anya indriyāgniṣhu juhvati || 26 ||

translations.english: Some offer the sense organs, like hearing, into the fire of self-control; others offer the sense objects, like sound, into the fire of the senses.

verses.original:
सर्वाणीन्द्रियकर्माणि प्राणकर्माणि चापरे ।
आत्मसंयमयोगाग्नौ जुह्वति ज्ञानदीपिते ॥ २७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvāṇīndriya-karmāṇi prāṇa-karmāṇi chāpare |
ātma-saṁyama-yogāgnau juhvati jñāna-dīpite || 27 ||

translations.english: Others offer all the functions of the senses and the functions of the life-breath (prāṇa-karma) into the fire of the Yoga of self-control, which is kindled by knowledge.

verses.original:
द्रव्ययज्ञास्तपोयज्ञा योगयज्ञास्तथापरे ।
स्वाध्यायज्ञानयज्ञाश्च यतयः संशितव्रताः ॥ २८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
dravya-yajñās tapo-yajñā yoga-yajñās tathāpare |
svādhyāya-jñāna-yajñāśh cha yatayaḥ saṁśhita-vratāḥ || 28 ||

translations.english: Some offer their wealth (dravy-yajña) as a sacrifice; others offer austerity (tapo-yajña); some offer practice of Yoga (yoga-yajña); and others, of sharp vows, offer knowledge and study of scriptures (svādhyāya-yajña).

verses.original:
अपाने जुह्वति प्राणं प्राणेऽपानं तथापरे ।
प्राणापानगती रुद्ध्वा प्राणायामपरायणाः ॥ २ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
apāne juhvati prāṇaṁ prāṇe 'pānaṁ tathāpare |
prāṇāpāna-gatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāma-parāyaṇāḥ || 29 ||

translations.english: Others, dedicated to the practice of **prāṇāyāma** (breath control), offer the outgoing breath (prāṇa) into the incoming breath (apāna), and the incoming breath into the outgoing breath, thus arresting the movement of both breaths.

verses.original:
अपरे नियताहाराः प्राणान्प्राणेषु जुह्वति ।
सर्वेऽप्येते यज्ञविदो यज्ञक्षपितकल्मषाः ॥ ३० ॥
verses.transliteration:
apare niyatāhārāḥ prāṇān prāṇeṣhu juhvati |
sarve 'py ete yajña-vido yajña-kṣhapita-kalmaṣhāḥ || 30 ||

translations.english: Still others, restricting their diet, offer their life-breaths into the life-breaths. All these knowers of sacrifice are purified of sin by such performances.

verses.original:
यज्ञशिष्टामृतभुजो यान्ति ब्रह्म सनातनम् ।
नायं लोकोऽस्त्ययज्ञस्य कुतोऽन्यः कुरुसत्तम ॥ ३१ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yajña-śhiṣhṭāmṛta-bhujo yānti brahma sanātanam |
nāyaṁ loko 'sty ayajñasya kuto 'nyaḥ kuru-sattama || 31 ||

translations.english: Those who taste the nectar of the remnants of the sacrifice attain the eternal Supreme Spirit (Brahman). O best of the Kurus (Arjuna), this world is not for one who does not perform sacrifice; how then can the next world be?

verses.original:
एवं बहुविधा यज्ञा वितता ब्रह्मणो मुखे ।
कर्मजान्विद्धि तान्सर्वानेवं ज्ञात्वा विमोक्ष्यसे ॥ ३२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
evaṁ bahu-vidhā yajñā vitatā brahmaṇo mukhe |
karmān viddhi tān sarvān evaṁ jñātvā vimokṣhyase || 32 ||

translations.english: Thus, various types of sacrifices are described in the Vedas. Know them all to be born of action. Knowing this, you will attain liberation.

verses.original:
श्रेयान्द्रव्यमयाद्यज्ञाज्ज्ञानयज्ञः परन्तप ।
सर्वं कर्मखिलं पार्थ ज्ञाने परिसमाप्यते ॥ ३३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhreyān dravyamayād yajñāj jñāna-yajñaḥ parantapa |
sarvaṁ karmākhilaṁ pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate || 33 ||

translations.english: The sacrifice performed in knowledge (Jñāna Yajña) is superior to any sacrifice performed with material objects (dravya-yajña), O conqueror of the foe. O son of Pṛthā, all actions culminate in knowledge.

verses.original:
तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया ।
उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः ॥ ३४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tad viddhi praṇipātena paripraśhnena sevayā |
upadekṣhyanti te jñānaṁ jñāninas tattva-darśhinaḥ || 34 ||

translations.english: Learn this knowledge by humbly approaching a spiritual master. Inquire from him submissively and render service unto him. The realized souls, who have seen the truth, will impart knowledge to you.

verses.original:
यज्ज्ञात्वा न पुनर्मोहमेवं यास्यसि पाण्डव ।
येन भूतान्यशेषेण द्रक्ष्यस्यात्मन्यथो मयि ॥ ३५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yaj jñātvā na punar moham evaṁ yāsyasi pāṇḍava |
yena bhūtāny aśheṣheṇa drakṣhyasy ātmany atho mayi || 35 ||

translations.english: Having obtained this knowledge, O son of Pāṇḍu, you will never again fall into delusion, for by this knowledge you will see all living beings within your own Self, and thus within Me.

verses.original:
अपि चेदसि पापेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यः पापकृत्तमः ।
सर्वं ज्ञानप्लवेनैव वृजिनं सन्तरिष्यसि ॥ ३६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
api ched asi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpa-kṛttamaḥ |
sarvaṁ jñāna-plavenaiva vṛjinaṁ santariṣhyasi || 36 ||

translations.english: Even if you are the most sinful of all sinners, you will cross over the ocean of sin by the raft of knowledge alone.

verses.original:
यथैधांसि समिद्धोऽग्निर्भस्मसात्कुरुतेऽर्जुन ।
ज्ञानाग्निः सर्वकर्माणि भस्मसात्कुरुते तथा ॥ ३७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yathaidhāṁsi samiddho 'gnir bhasmasāt kurute 'rjuna |
jñānāgniḥ sarva-karmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute tathā || 37 ||

translations.english: Just as a blazing fire reduces wood to ashes, O Arjuna, so does the fire of knowledge reduce all reactions of material activities to ashes.

verses.original:
न हि ज्ञानेन सदृशं पवित्रमिह विद्यते ।
तत्स्वयं योगसंसिद्धः कालेनात्मनि विन्दति ॥ ३८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
na hi jñānena sadṛśhaṁ pavitram iha vidyate |
tat svayaṁ yoga-saṁsiddhaḥ kālenātmani vindati || 38 ||

translations.english: There is nothing in this world as purifying as knowledge. One who has attained perfection in Yoga finds this knowledge naturally within himself in due course of time.

verses.original:
श्रद्धावाँल्लभते ज्ञानं तत्परः संयतेन्द्रियः ।
ज्ञानं लब्ध्वा परां शान्तिमचिरेणाधिगच्छति ॥ ३ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhraddhāvān labhate jñānaṁ tat-paraḥ saṁyatendriyaḥ |
jñānaṁ labdhvā parāṁ śhāntim achireṇādhigachchhati || 39 ||

translations.english: One who is full of faith, dedicated to it, and has control over the senses, achieves this knowledge. Having obtained knowledge, he quickly attains the supreme peace.

verses.original:
अज्ञश्चाश्रद्दधानश्च संशयात्मा विनश्यति ।
नायं लोकोऽस्ति न परो न सुखं संशयात्मनः ॥ ४० ॥
verses.transliteration:
ajñśh chāśhraddadhānaśh cha saṁśhayātmā vinaśhyati |
nāyaṁ loko 'sti na paro na sukhaṁ saṁśhayātmanaḥ || 40 ||

translations.english: The ignorant, the faithless, and the doubting person perishes. For the doubting soul there is neither this world nor the next, nor any happiness.

verses.original:
योगसन्न्यस्तकर्माणं ज्ञानसञ्छिन्नसंशयम् ।
आत्मवन्तं न कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय ॥ ४ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yoga-sannyasta-karmāṇaṁ jñāna-sañchhinna-saṁśhayam |
ātmavantaṁ na karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya || 41 ||

translations.english: O conqueror of wealth (Arjuna), one who has renounced the fruits of action by Yoga, whose doubts are destroyed by knowledge, and who is situated in the Self, is not bound by actions.

verses.original:
तस्मादज्ञानसम्भूतं हृत्स्थं ज्ञानसिनात्मनः ।
छित्त्वैनं संशयं योगमातिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भारत ॥ ४२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmād ajñāna-sambhūtaṁ hṛt-sthaṁ jñānāsinātmanaḥ |
chhittvainam saṁśhayaṁ yogam ātiṣhṭhottiṣhṭha bhārata || 42 ||

translations.english: Therefore, O descendant of Bharata, cut off the ignorance-born doubt residing in your heart with the sword of knowledge. Be steadfast in Yoga and arise (to fight).

chapters.name: Karma Sannyāsa Yoga: The Yoga of Renunciation in Action
chapters.summary: Arjuna asks whether work (Karma Yoga) or renunciation (Sannyāsa) is superior. Krishna explains that both paths lead to the same goal, but performing duty without attachment, as practiced in Karma Yoga, is easier and practically superior.

verses.original:
अर्जुन उवाच
संन्यास कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि ।
यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम् ॥ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
sannyāsaṁ karmaṇāṁ kṛṣhṇa punar yogaṁ cha śhaṁsasi |
yach chhrey etayor ekaṁ tan me brūhi suniśhchitam || 1 ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: O Krishna, You praise both the renunciation of actions (sannyāsa) and the performance of action (karma yoga). Please tell me decisively which of the two is better.

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
संन्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निःश्रेयसकरावुभौ ।
तयोस्तु कर्मसंन्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते ॥ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
sannyāsaḥ karma-yogaśh cha niḥśhreyasa-karāv ubhau |
tayos tu karma-sannyāsāt karma-yogo viśiṣhyate || 2 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: Both the renunciation of action (sannyāsa) and the performance of action (karma yoga) lead to the ultimate good. But of the two, the yoga of action is superior to the renunciation of action.

verses.original:
ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति ।
निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते ॥ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
jñeyaḥ sa nitya-sannyāsī yo na dveṣhṭi na kāṅkṣhati |
nirdvandvo hi mahā-bāho sukhaṁ bandhāt pramuchyate || 3 ||

translations.english: He should be known as a perpetual renunciant who neither hates nor desires. Free from the dualities, O mighty-armed (Arjuna), he is easily liberated from bondage.

verses.original:
साङ्ख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिताः ।
एकमप्यास्थितः सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम् ॥ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sāṅkhya-yogau pṛthag bālāḥ pravadanti na paṇḍitāḥ |
ekam apy āsthitaḥ samyag ubhayor vindate phalam || 4 ||

translations.english: Only the ignorant speak of Sāṅkhya (the path of knowledge/renunciation) and Yoga (the path of action) as different; the wise do not. One who is truly established in one properly receives the fruit of both.

verses.original:
यत्साङ्ख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते ।
एकं साङ्ख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति ॥ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yat sāṅkhyaiḥ prāpyate sthānaṁ tad yogair api gamyate |
ekaṁ sāṅkhyaṁ cha yogaṁ cha yaḥ paśhyati sa paśhyati || 5 ||

translations.english: The position attained by the followers of Sāṅkhya is also reached by the followers of Yoga. One who sees Sāṅkhya and Yoga as one truly sees.

verses.original:
संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः ।
योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म न चिरेणाधिगच्छति ॥ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sannyāsas tu mahā-bāho duḥkham āptum ayogataḥ |
yoga-yukto munir brahma na chireṇādhigachchhati || 6 ||

translations.english: But renunciation (sannyāsa), O mighty-armed (Arjuna), is difficult to attain without Karma Yoga. A sage purified by Yoga attains the Supreme quickly.

verses.original:
योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः ।
सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते ॥ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yoga-yukto viśhuddhātmā vijitātmā jitendriyaḥ |
sarva-bhūtātma-bhūtātmā kurvann api na lipyate || 7 ||

translations.english: One who is engaged in Karma Yoga, whose mind is purified, who has control over the body and senses, and whose self is the Self of all beings—such a person, though acting, is never entangled.

verses.original:
नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित् ।
पश्यञ्शृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपञ्श्वसन् ॥ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
naiva kiñchit karomīti yukto manyeta tattva-vit |
paśhyañ śhṛṇvan spṛśhañ jighrann aśhnan gachchhan svapañ śhvasan || 8 ||

translations.english: The soul fixed in divine consciousness, the knower of truth, should think: 'I am not the doer,' even while seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, moving, sleeping, or breathing.

verses.original:
प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि ।
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन् ॥ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
pralapan visṛjan gṛhṇann unmiṣhann nimiṣhann api |
indriyāṇīndriyārtheṣhu vartanta iti dhārayan || 9 ||

translations.english: While speaking, letting go, grasping, or opening and closing the eyes—he knows that only the material senses are operating on their objects.

verses.original:
ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः ।
लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा ॥ १० ॥
verses.transliteration:
brahmaṇy ādhāya karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā karoti yaḥ |
lipyate na sa pāpena padma-patram ivāmbhasā || 10 ||

translations.english: One who performs action by dedicating it to Brahman (the Supreme) and giving up attachment, remains untouched by sin, just as a lotus leaf remains untouched by water.

verses.original:
कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि ।
योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वात्मशुद्धये ॥ ११ ॥
verses.transliteration:
kāyena manasā buddhyā kevalair indriyair api |
yoginaḥ karma kurvanti saṅgaṁ tyaktvātma-śhuddhaye || 11 ||

translations.english: The Yogis perform action without attachment, using the body, mind, intellect, and senses only for the purpose of self-purification.

verses.original:
युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकीम् ।
अयुक्तः कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते ॥ १२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yuktaḥ karma-phalaṁ tyaktvā śhāntim āpnoti naiṣhṭhikīm |
ayuktaḥ kāma-kāreṇa phale sakto nibadhyate || 12 ||

translations.english: The soul devoted to God (yukta) gives up the results of action and attains steady peace, whereas the non-devotee (ayukta), driven by desire and attached to the results, becomes entangled.

verses.original:
सर्वकर्माणि मनसा सन्न्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी ।
नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् ॥ १३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-karmāṇi manasā sannyasyāste sukhaṁ vaśhī |
nava-dvāre pure dehī naiva kurvan na kārayan || 13 ||

translations.english: The embodied soul, having renounced all actions mentally, remains happy in the city of nine gates (the body), neither doing anything nor causing anything to be done.

verses.original:
न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः ।
न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते ॥ १४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
na kartṛtvaṁ na karmāṇi lokasya sṛjati prabhuḥ |
na karma-phala-saṁyogaṁ svabhāvas tu pravartate || 14 ||

translations.english: The embodied soul, the Lord of the city, neither creates the faculty of action, nor actions themselves, nor the connection of actions with their results. It is nature (prakṛti) alone that works.

verses.original:
नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः ।
अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः ॥ १५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
nādatte kasyachit pāpaṁ na chaiva sukṛtaṁ vibhuḥ |
ajñānenāvṛtaṁ jñānaṁ tena muhyanti jantavaḥ || 15 ||

translations.english: The Lord does not take responsibility for anyone's sinful or pious actions. Knowledge is covered by ignorance (ajñāna)—by this, the living beings are bewildered.

verses.original:
ज्ञानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः ।
तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम् ॥ १६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
jñānena tu tad ajñānaṁ yeṣhāṁ nāśhitam ātmanaḥ |
teṣhām āditya-vaj jñānaṁ prakāśhayati tat param || 16 ||

translations.english: But for those whose ignorance is destroyed by knowledge of the Self, that knowledge, like the sun, reveals the Supreme Truth.

verses.original:
तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः ।
गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः ॥ १७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tad-buddhayas tad-ātmānas tan-niṣhṭhās tat-parāyaṇāḥ |
gachchhanty apunar-āvṛttiṁ jñāna-nirdhūta-kalmaṣhāḥ || 17 ||

translations.english: Those whose intellect and mind are merged in the Supreme, who are firmly devoted to Him, and who take Him as their ultimate goal, become cleansed of all impurities by knowledge and attain liberation (from rebirth).

verses.original:
विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि ।
शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः ॥ १८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
vidyā-vinaya-sampanne brāhmaṇe gavi hastini |
śhuni chaiva śhva-pāke cha paṇḍitāḥ sama-darśhinaḥ || 18 ||

translations.english: The learned and humble sages see with equal vision a learned and gentle brāhmaṇa, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a dog-eater (outcast).

verses.original:
इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः ।
निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद् ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः ॥ १९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ihaiva tair jitaḥ sargo yeṣhāṁ sāmye sthitaṁ manaḥ |
nirdoṣhaṁ hi samaṁ brahma tasmād brahmaṇi te sthitāḥ || 19 ||

translations.english: Those whose minds are established in equality conquer the cycle of birth and death even in this life. Since the Supreme is flawless and equal to all, they are situated in the Supreme Spirit.

verses.original:
न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् ।
स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद् ब्रह्मणि स्थितः ॥ २० ॥
verses.transliteration:
na prahṛṣhyet priyaṁ prāpya nodvijet prāpya chāpriyam |
sthirha-buddhir asammūḍho brahma-vid brahmaṇi sthitaḥ || 20 ||

translations.english: A person who is established in Brahman and has a steady intellect is neither joyful upon obtaining what is pleasant nor distressed upon obtaining what is unpleasant, being free from delusion.

verses.original:
बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम् ।
स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते ॥ २१ ॥
verses.transliteration:
bāhya-sparśheṣhv asaktātmā vindaty ātmani yat sukham |
sa brahma-yoga-yuktātmā sukham akṣhayam aśhnute || 21 ||

translations.english: One whose consciousness is unattached to external sense objects finds the happiness that is in the Self. Such a person, engaged in the Yoga of Brahman, enjoys everlasting happiness.

verses.original:
ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते ।
आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः ॥ २२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ye hi saṁsparśha-jā bhogā duḥkha-yonaya eva te |
ādhyanta-vantaḥ kaunteya na teṣhu ramate budhaḥ || 22 ||

translations.english: The pleasures derived from contact with the senses are verily sources of misery, O son of Kunti, for they have a beginning and an end. The wise person does not delight in them.

verses.original:
शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात् ।
कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः ॥ २३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhaknotīhaiva yaḥ soḍhuṁ prāk śharīra-vimokṣhaṇāt |
kāma-krodhodbhavaṁ vegaṁ sa yuktaḥ sa sukhī naraḥ || 23 ||

translations.english: One who is able to withstand the impulses of desire and anger in this world, before giving up the body, is a yogi, and is a happy human being.

verses.original:
योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः ।
स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति ॥ २४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yo 'ntaḥ-sukho 'ntar-ārāmas tathāntar-jyotir eva yaḥ |
sa yogī brahma-nirvāṇaṁ brahma-bhūto 'dhigachchhati || 24 ||

translations.english: One who is happy within, who rejoices within, and who is illuminated within, such a yogi, being one with the Supreme Spirit, attains liberation (Brahma Nirvāṇa).

verses.original:
लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः ।
छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः ॥ २५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
labhante brahma-nirvāṇam ṛṣhayaḥ kṣhīṇa-kalmaṣhāḥ |
chhinna-dvaidhā yatātmānaḥ sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ || 25 ||

translations.english: Those seers (rishis) whose sins are destroyed, whose doubts are cleared, whose minds are disciplined, and who are devoted to the welfare of all beings, attain liberation in Brahman.

verses.original:
कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् ।
अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम् ॥ २६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
kāma-krodha-viyuktānāṁ yatīnāṁ yata-chetasām |
abhito brahma-nirvāṇaṁ vartate viditātmanām || 26 ||

translations.english: To those ascetics who are free from desire and anger, who have controlled their minds, and who have realized the Self, the state of liberation is near at hand.

verses.original:
स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवोः ।
प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ ॥ २७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sparśhān kṛtvā bahir bāhyān śhakhśhuśh chaivāntare bhruvoḥ |
prāṇāpānau samau kṛtvā nāsābhyantara-chāriṇau || 27 ||

translations.english: Shutting out all external contacts, fixing the gaze between the eyebrows, equalizing the incoming and outgoing breaths moving within the nostrils—

verses.original:
यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायणः ।
विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः ॥ २८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yatendriya-mano-buddhir munir mokṣha-parāyaṇaḥ |
vigatechchhā-bhaya-krodho yaḥ sadā mukta eva saḥ || 28 ||

translations.english: —the sage, having controlled the senses, mind, and intellect, who is focused on liberation, and is free from desire, fear, and anger, is verily liberated at all times.

verses.original:
भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् ।
सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति ॥ २ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
bhoktāraṁ yajña-tapasāṁ sarva-loka-maheśhvaram |
suhṛdaṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ jñātvā māṁ śhāntim ṛchchhati || 29 ||

translations.english: Knowing Me as the ultimate recipient of all sacrifices and austerities, the Supreme Lord of all worlds, and the benevolent friend of all beings, the yogi attains peace.

chapters.name: Dhyāna Yoga: The Yoga of Meditation
chapters.summary: Krishna explains the detailed process of **Dhyāna Yoga** (meditation), emphasizing the importance of self-control, detachment, solitude, and proper posture to achieve steadiness of mind and realize the Supreme Self.

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः ।
स सन्न्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः ॥ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
anāśhritaḥ karma-phalaṁ kāryaṁ karma karoti yaḥ |
sa sannyāsī cha yogī cha na niragnir na chākriyaḥ || 1 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: One who performs his prescribed duty without depending on the results of action is a true renouncer (sannyāsī) and a true yogi, not merely one who has renounced fire sacrifices or given up action.

verses.original:
यं सन्न्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव ।
न ह्यसंन्यस्तसङ्कल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन ॥ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yaṁ sannyāsam iti prāhur yogaṁ taṁ viddhi pāṇḍava |
na hy asannyasta-saṅkalpo yogī bhavati kaśhchana || 2 ||

translations.english: O son of Pāṇḍu (Arjuna), know that what is called renunciation (sannyāsa) is identical with the practice of Yoga (Karma Yoga). No one becomes a yogi unless he renounces the desire for self-serving actions.

verses.original:
आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते ।
योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते ॥ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ārurukṣhor muner yogaṁ karma kāraṇam uchyate |
yogārūḍhasya tasyaiva śhamaḥ kāraṇam uchyate || 3 ||

translations.english: For the sage who wishes to ascend to the stage of yoga, action without attachment is the means; for the one who has already attained the stage of yoga, tranquility (cessation from action) is the means.

verses.original:
यदा हि नेन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते ।
सर्वसङ्कल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते ॥ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yadā hi nendriyārtheṣhu na karmasv anuṣhajjate |
sarva-saṅkalpa-sannyāsī yogārūḍhas tadocyate || 4 ||

translations.english: A person is said to be established in Yoga when, having renounced all material desires and selfish intentions, he is neither attached to the sense objects nor to the actions.

verses.original:
उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत् ।
आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः ॥ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
uddhared ātmanātmānaṁ nātmānam avasādayet |
ātmaiva hy ātmano bandhur ātmaiva ripur ātmanaḥ || 5 ||

translations.english: One must elevate oneself by one's own mind, and not degrade oneself. For the mind is the friend of the self, and the mind is also the enemy of the self.

verses.original:
बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः ।
अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत् ॥ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
bandhur ātmātmanas tasya yenātmaivātmanā jitaḥ |
anātmanas tu śhatrutve vartetātmaiva śhatru-vat || 6 ||

translations.english: For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is the best of friends; but for one who has failed to do so, the mind remains the greatest enemy.

verses.original:
जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः ।
शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः ॥ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
jitātmanaḥ praśhāntasya paramātmā samāhitaḥ |
śhītoṣhṇa-sukha-duḥkheṣhu tathā mānāpamānayoḥ || 7 ||

translations.english: One who has conquered the mind attains tranquility, and his Higher Self is concentrated, for he is poised in cold and heat, happiness and distress, honor and dishonor.

verses.original:
ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः ।
युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः ॥ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
jñāna-vijñāna-tṛptātmā kūṭastho vijitendriyaḥ |
yukta ity uchyate yogī sama-loṣhṭāśhma-kāñchanaḥ || 8 ||

translations.english: A person is said to be established in Yoga when he is satisfied with both knowledge (jñāna) and realization (vijñāna), is unwavering, has control over the senses, and regards a lump of clay, a stone, and gold as equal.

verses.original:
सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु ।
साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते ॥ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
suhṛn-mitrāry-udāsīna-madhyastha-dveṣhya-bandhuṣhu |
sādhuṣhv api cha pāpeṣhu sama-buddhir viśiṣhyate || 9 ||

translations.english: He is considered superior who is of equal intellect toward well-wishers, friends, enemies, neutrals, arbiters, the envious, relatives, and also toward the righteous and the sinful.

verses.original: योगी युञ्जीत सततमात्मानं रहसि स्थितः ।\एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीरपरिग्रहः ॥ १० ॥
verses.transliteration:
yogī yuñjīta satatam ātmānaṁ rahasi sthitaḥ |
ekākī yata-chittātmā nirāśhīr aparigrahaḥ || 10 ||

translations.english: A yogi should constantly engage his body, mind, and soul in the service of the Supreme, residing in a secluded place, alone, with a controlled mind and body, free from desires and sense of possession.

verses.original:
शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः ।
नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम् ॥ ११ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhuchau deśhe pratiṣhṭhāpya sthiram āsanam ātmanaḥ |
nātyuchchritaṁ nāti-nīchaṁ chailājina-kuśhottaram || 11 ||

translations.english: The yogi should set up a firm seat for himself in a clean place—neither too high nor too low—covered with kusha grass, a deer skin, and a cloth, one over the other.

verses.original:
तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः ।
उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये ॥ १२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tatraikāgraṁ manaḥ kṛtvā yata-chittendriya-kriyaḥ |
upaviśhyāsane yuñjyād yogam ātma-viśhuddhaye || 12 ||

translations.english: Sitting there, he should make the mind one-pointed, controlling the activities of the mind and senses, and practice Yoga for the purification of the self.

verses.original:
समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः ।
सम्प्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन् ॥ १३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
samaṁ kāya-śhiro-grīvaṁ dhārayann achalaṁ sthiraḥ |
samprekṣhya nāsikāgraṁ svaṁ diśhaśh chānavalokayan || 13 ||

translations.english: Holding the body, head, and neck erect, keeping them steady and motionless, gazing at the tip of his nose, and not looking around in any direction.

verses.original:
प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः ।
मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः ॥ १४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
praśhāntātmā vigata-bhīr brahmachāri-vrate sthitaḥ |
manaḥ saṁyamya mach-chitto yukta āsīta mat-paraḥ || 14 ||

translations.english: With a serene and fearless mind, steadfast in the vow of celibacy, the yogi should control the mind, think of Me, and sit absorbed in Me, having Me as the supreme goal.

verses.original:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः ।
शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति ॥ १५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī niyata-mānasaḥ |
śhāntiṁ nirvāṇa-paramāṁ mat-saṁsthām adhigachchhati || 15 ||

translations.english: Thus, constantly engaging the mind in the Self, the yogi, whose mind is controlled, attains the peace that culminates in liberation (Nirvāṇa) and rests in Me.

verses.original:
नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः ।
न चातिस्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन ॥ १६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
nātyaśhnatas tu yogo 'sti na chaikāntam anaśhnataḥ |
na chāti-svapna-śhīlasya jāgrato naiva chārjuna || 16 ||

translations.english: O Arjuna, Yoga is not for one who eats too much or who eats too little, nor for one who sleeps too much or who remains awake too long.

verses.original:
युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु ।
युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा ॥ १७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yuktāhāra-vihārasya yukta-cheṣhṭasya karmasu |
yukta-svapnāvabodhasya yogo bhavati duḥkha-hā || 17 ||

translations.english: But for the person whose eating, resting, actions in work, and sleep and wakefulness are regulated, Yoga becomes the destroyer of all sorrow.

verses.original:
यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते ।
निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा ॥ १८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yadā viniyataṁ chittam ātmany evāvatiṣhṭhate |
niḥspṛhaḥ sarva-kāmebhyo yukta ity uchyate tadā || 18 ||

translations.english: When the perfectly disciplined mind becomes established in the Self alone, free from all desires, then that person is said to be established in Yoga.

verses.original:
यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता ।
योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः ॥ १९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yathā dīpo nivāta-stho neṅgate sopamā smṛtā |
yogino yata-chittasya yuñjato yogam ātmanaḥ || 19 ||

translations.english: Just as a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, that is the simile used for a yogi whose mind is controlled and who practices meditation on the Self.

verses.original:
यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया ।
यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति ॥ २० ॥
verses.transliteration:
yatroparamate chittaṁ niruddhaṁ yoga-sevayā |
yatra chaivātmanātmānaṁ paśhyann ātmani tuṣhyati || 20 ||

translations.english: When the mind, restrained by the practice of Yoga, attains cessation (from material activity), and when, seeing the Self by the Self, the yogi is satisfied in the Self.

verses.original:
सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् ।
वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः ॥ २१ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sukham ātyantikaṁ yat tad buddhi-grāhyam atīndriyam |
vetti yatra na chaivāyaṁ sthitaśh chalati tattvataḥ || 21 ||

translations.english: In that state, he experiences the transcendental bliss, which is known through the purified intellect and is beyond the reach of the senses. Established in this reality, he never deviates from the truth.

verses.original:
यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः ।
यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते ॥ २२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yaṁ labdhvā chāparaṁ lābhaṁ manyate nādhikaṁ tataḥ |
yasmin sthito na duḥkhena guruṇāpi vichālyate || 22 ||

translations.english: Having attained that, he considers no other gain to be greater; and being situated in that, he is not disturbed even by the greatest difficulty.

verses.original:
तं विद्याद्दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसंज्ञितम् ।
स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा ॥ २३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
taṁ vidyād duḥkha-saṁyoga-viyogaṁ yoga-saṁjñitam |
sa niśhchayena yoktavyo yogo 'nirviṇṇa-chetasā || 23 ||

translations.english: Know this state of severance from contact with suffering to be Yoga. This Yoga must be practiced with determination and an undeterred mind.

verses.original:
सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामांस्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः ।
मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः ॥ २४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
saṅkalpa-prabhavān kāmāns tyaktvā sarvān aśheṣhataḥ |
manasaivendriya-grāmaṁ viniyamya samantataḥ || 24 ||

translations.english: One should completely abandon all desires born of selfish intention, and restrain the whole group of senses from all sides with the mind alone.

verses.original:
शनैः शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया ।
आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ॥ २५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhanaiḥ śhanair uparamed buddhyā dhṛti-gṛhītayā |
ātma-saṁsthaṁ manaḥ kṛtvā na kiñchid api chintayet || 25 ||

translations.english: Gradually, gradually, one should become tranquil by means of the intellect controlled by firm resolve. Making the mind rest in the Self, one should think of nothing else.

verses.original:
यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम् ।
ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत् ॥ २६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yato yato niśhcharati manaśh chañchalam asthiram |
tatas tato niyamyaitad ātmany eva vaśhaṁ nayet || 26 ||

translations.english: Whenever the restless and unsteady mind wanders away, one must bring it back from those objects and constantly keep it under the control of the Self.

verses.original:
प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम् ।
उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम् ॥ २७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
praśhānta-manasaṁ hy enaṁ yoginaṁ sukham uttamam |
upaiti śhānta-rajasaṁ brahma-bhūtam akalmaṣham || 27 ||

translations.english: Supreme happiness comes to the yogi whose mind is peaceful, whose passions (rajas) are subdued, who is free from sin, and who has achieved oneness with Brahman.

verses.original:
युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः ।
सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते ॥ २८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yuñjann evaṁ sadātmānaṁ yogī vigata-kalmaṣhaḥ |
sukhena brahma-saṁsparśham atyantaṁ sukham aśhnute || 28 ||

translations.english: The yogi, thus constantly engaging the self in Yoga, and freed from all impurity, easily attains the boundless happiness of contact with Brahman.

verses.original:
सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि ।
ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः ॥ २ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-bhūta-stham ātmānaṁ sarva-bhūtāni chātmani |
īkṣhate yoga-yuktātmā sarvatra sama-darśhanaḥ || 29 ||

translations.english: The yogi, whose mind is disciplined by Yoga, sees the Self residing in all beings and all beings in the Self; he sees the same everywhere.

verses.original:
यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति ।
तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति ॥ ३० ॥
verses.transliteration:
yo māṁ paśhyati sarvatra sarvaṁ cha mayi paśhyati |
tasyāhaṁ na praṇaśhyāmi sa cha me na praṇaśhyati || 30 ||

translations.english: For one who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, I am never lost to him, nor is he ever lost to Me.

verses.original:
सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः ।
सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते ॥ ३ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-bhūta-sthitaṁ yo māṁ bhajaty ekatvam āsthitaḥ |
sarvathā vartamāno 'pi sa yogī mayi vartate || 31 ||

translations.english: The yogi who, established in oneness, worships Me, who resides in all beings, lives in Me, whatever his mode of life may be.

verses.original:
आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन ।
सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः ॥ ३२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ātmaopamyena sarvatra samaṁ paśhyati yo 'rjuna |
sukhaṁ vā yadi vā duḥkhaṁ sa yogī paramo mataḥ || 32 ||

translations.english: O Arjuna, that yogi is considered the highest who, through the analogy of his own self, sees the equality of all beings, whether in happiness or in distress.

verses.original:
अर्जुन उवाच
योऽयं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन ।
एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम् ॥ ३३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
yo 'yaṁ yogas tvayā proktaḥ sāmyena madhusūdana |
etasyāhaṁ na paśhyāmi chañchalatvāt sthitiṁ sthirām || 33 ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: O Madhusūdana (Krishna), this system of Yoga which You have summarized by equality, I do not see how it can be stable, due to the restlessness (of the mind).

verses.original:
चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम् ।
तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम् ॥ ३४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
chañchalaṁ hi manaḥ kṛṣhṇa pramāthi balavad dṛḍham |
tasyāhaṁ nigrahaṁ manye vāyor iva suduṣhkaram || 34 ||

translations.english: For the mind is restless, turbulent, strong, and obstinate, O Krishna. I think controlling it is as difficult as controlling the wind.

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम् ।
अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते ॥ ३५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
asaṁśhayaṁ mahā-bāho mano durnigrahaṁ chalam |
abhyāsena tu kaunteya vairāgyeṇa cha gṛhyate || 35 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: O mighty-armed son of Kunti, undoubtedly the mind is restless and difficult to curb. But it can be controlled by constant practice (abhyāsa) and by detachment (vairāgya).

verses.original:
असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः ।
वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः ॥ ३६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
asaṁyatātmanā yogo duṣhprāpa iti me matiḥ |
vaśhyātmanā tu yatatā śhakyo 'vāptum upāyataḥ || 36 ||

translations.english: Yoga is difficult to attain for one whose mind is undisciplined; but for the person who controls the mind and strives earnestly, it is possible to succeed by proper means.

verses.original:
अर्जुन उवाच
अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः ।
अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति ॥ ३७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
ayatiḥ śhraddhayopeto yogāch chalita-mānasaḥ |
aprāpya yoga-saṁsiddhiṁ kāṁ gatiṁ kṛṣhṇa gachchhati || 37 ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: O Krishna, what is the destination of the unsuccessful yogi, who starts with faith but whose mind wanders away from Yoga and who fails to attain perfection in Yoga?

verses.original:
कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति ।
अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि ॥ ३ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
kachchin nobhaya-vibhraṣhṭaśh chhinnābhram iva naśhyati |
apratiṣhṭho mahā-bāho vimūḍho brahmaṇaḥ pathi || 38 ||

translations.english: O mighty-armed one, does he not perish like a broken cloud, having lost his position in both the material and spiritual spheres, being deluded on the path to Brahman?

verses.original:
एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः ।
त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते ॥ ३ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
etan me saṁśhayaṁ kṛṣhṇa chhettum arhasy aśheṣhataḥ |
tvad-anyaḥ saṁśhayasyāsya chhettā na hy upapadyate || 39 ||

translations.english: O Krishna, please dispel this doubt of mine completely. Other than You, no one can be found who is capable of destroying this doubt.

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते ।
न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति ॥ ४० ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
pārtha naiveha nāmutra vināśhas tasya vidyate |
na hi kalyāṇa-kṛt kaśhchid durgatiṁ tāta gachchhati || 40 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: O son of Pṛthā, neither in this world nor in the next is there destruction for him. Indeed, no one who performs good deeds, My friend, ever meets a miserable end.

verses.original:
प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः ।
शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते ॥ ४ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
prāpya puṇya-kṛtāṁ lokān uṣhitvā śhāśhvatīḥ samāḥ |
śhuchīnāṁ śhrīmatāṁ gehe yoga-bhraṣhṭo 'bhijāyate || 41 ||

translations.english: The unsuccessful yogi, after dwelling for many, many years in the realms of the righteous, is born again in the home of pious and prosperous people.

verses.original:
अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम् ।
एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम् ॥ ४२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
athavā yoginām eva kule bhavati dhīmatām |
etad dhi durlabhataraṁ loke janma yad īdṛśham || 42 ||

translations.english: Or, he may be born into a family of enlightened yogis, though such a birth is exceedingly rare in this world.

verses.original:
तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम् ।
यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन ॥ ४३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tatra taṁ buddhi-saṁyogaṁ labhate paurva-dehikam |
yatate cha tato bhūyaḥ saṁsiddhau kuru-nandana || 43 ||

translations.english: There, O joy of the Kurus, he regains the intellectual consciousness of his previous life, and striving again, he works for complete perfection.

verses.original:
पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः ।
जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते ॥ ४४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
pūrvābhyāsena tenaiva hriyate hy avaśho 'pi saḥ |
jijñāsur api yogasya śhabda-brahmātivartate || 44 ||

translations.english: By the force of his past practice, he is carried forward, even against his will. Even the aspiring seeker of Yoga transcends the rituals described in the Vedas.

verses.original:
प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः ।
अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ॥ ४ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
prayatnād yatamānas tu yogī saṁśhuddha-kilbiṣhaḥ |
aneka-janma-saṁsiddhas tato yāti parāṁ gatim || 45 ||

translations.english: The yogi, striving earnestly, cleansed of all impurities, and perfecting himself through many births, ultimately attains the supreme goal.

verses.original:
तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानिभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः ।
कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन ॥ ४६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tapasvibhyo 'dhiko yogī jñānibhyo 'pi mato 'dhikaḥ |
karmibhyaśh chādhiko yogī tasmād yogī bhavārjuna || 46 ||

translations.english: A yogi is superior to the ascetics (tapasvīs), superior to the philosophers (jñānīs), and superior to the fruitive workers (karmīs). Therefore, O Arjuna, be a yogi.

verses.original:
योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना ।
श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः ॥ ४७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yoginām api sarveṣhāṁ mad-gatenāntarātmanā |
śhraddhāvān bhajate yo māṁ sa me yuktatamo mataḥ || 47 ||

translations.english: And among all yogis, the one who constantly abides in Me, who serves Me with profound faith and love, and whose inner Self is fully devoted to Me—he is considered by Me to be the most perfectly unified (yuktatama).

chapters.name: Jñāna Vijñāna Yoga: The Yoga of Knowledge and Realization
chapters.summary: Krishna explains how He is the ultimate reality and the source of everything, detailing His two energies (material and spiritual), the difficulty of overcoming His divine illusion (Māyā), and the four types of devotees who worship Him.

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः ।
असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ॥ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
mayy āsakta-manāḥ pārtha yogaṁ yuñjan mad-āśhrayaḥ |
asaṁśhayaṁ samagraṁ māṁ yathā jñāsyasi tach chhṛṇu || 1 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: O son of Pṛthā, listen to how you can know Me completely, without any doubt, by practicing yoga with your mind attached to Me and taking refuge in Me.

verses.original:
ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः ।
यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ॥ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
jñānaṁ te 'haṁ sa-vijñānam idaṁ vakṣhyāmy aśheṣhataḥ |
yaj jñātvā neha bhūyo 'nyaj jñātavyam avaśhiṣhyate || 2 ||

translations.english: I shall now declare to you, without reserve, this **knowledge (jñāna) and realization (vijñāna)**. Knowing this, nothing further remains to be known in this world.

verses.original:
मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये ।
यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ॥ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
manuṣhyāṇāṁ sahasreṣhu kaśhchid yatati siddhaye |
yatatām api siddhānāṁ kaśhchin māṁ vetti tattvataḥ || 3 ||

translations.english: Among thousands of men, one may strive for perfection; and among those who have achieved perfection, scarcely one knows Me in reality.

verses.original:
भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च ।
अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ॥ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
bhūmir āpo 'nalo vāyuḥ khaṁ mano buddhir eva cha |
ahaṅkāra itīyaṁ me bhinnā prakṛtir aṣhṭadhā || 4 ||

translations.english: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect, and ego—these eight components form My separated **material energies (prakṛti)**.

verses.original:
अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् ।
जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ॥ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
apareyam itas tv anyāṁ prakṛtiṁ viddhi me parām |
jīva-bhūtāṁ mahā-bāho yayedaṁ dhāryate jagat || 5 ||

translations.english: This is My lower (material) energy. But know, O mighty-armed (Arjuna), that I have another, **superior energy**, which comprises the **living entities (jīva-bhūtāṁ)** by which this world is sustained.

verses.original:
एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय ।
अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा ॥ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
etad yonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇīty upadhāraya |
ahaṁ kṛtsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayas tathā || 6 ||

translations.english: Understand that all created beings have their origin in these two natures (energies). **I am the origin** of the entire universe, and also its dissolution.

verses.original:
मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय ।
मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ॥ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
mattaḥ parataraṁ nānyat kiñchid asti dhanañjaya |
mayi sarvam idaṁ protaṁ sūtre maṇi-gaṇā iva || 7 ||

translations.english: O conqueror of wealth (Arjuna), there is **no truth superior to Me**. Everything rests upon Me, as pearls strung on a thread.

verses.original:
रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः ।
प्रणवः सर्वदेवेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु ॥ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
raso 'ham apsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śhaśhi-sūryayoḥ |
praṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣhu śhabdaḥ khe pauruṣhaṁ nṛṣhu || 8 ||

translations.english: O son of Kunti, I am the **taste in water**, the **light** of the sun and the moon, the syllable **Om** in the Vedic mantras, the **sound** in ether, and the **ability** in man.

verses.original:
पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ ।
जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ॥ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛthivyāṁ cha tejaśh chāsmi vibhāvasau |
jīvanaṁ sarva-bhūteṣhu tapaśh chāsmi tapasviṣhu || 9 ||

translations.english: I am the **pure fragrance** of the earth, and the **heat** in fire. I am the **life** of all living beings, and I am the **austerity** in ascetics.

verses.original:
बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् ।
बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ॥ १० ॥
verses.transliteration:
bījaṁ māṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ viddhi pārtha sanātanam |
buddhir buddhimatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham || 10 ||

translations.english: O son of Pṛthā, know Me to be the **eternal seed** of all beings. I am the **intelligence** of the intelligent, and the **prowess** of the powerful.

verses.original:
बलं बलवतामस्मि कामरागविवर्जितम् ।
धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ॥ ११ ॥
verses.transliteration:
balaṁ balavatām asmi kāma-rāga-vivarjitam |
dharmāviruddho bhūteṣhu kāmo 'smi bharatarṣhabha || 11 ||

translations.english: I am the **strength** of the strong, devoid of passion and attachment. O best of the Bharatas, I am the **desire** in living beings that is not contrary to **dharma** (righteousness).

verses.original:
ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये ।
मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ॥ १२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ye chaiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasās tāmasāśh cha ye |
matta eveti tān viddhi na tv ahaṁ teṣhu te mayi || 12 ||

translations.english: Know that all states of being, whether **sāttvika** (goodness), **rājasika** (passion), or **tāmasika** (ignorance), are manifested by My power. **I am not under their control, but they are under My control**.

verses.original:
त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् ।
मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम् ॥ १३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tribhir guṇa-mayair bhāvair ebhiḥ sarvam idaṁ jagat |
mohitaṁ nābhijānāti mām ebhyaḥ param avyayam || 13 ||

translations.english: Deluded by these three **modes (guṇas)** of material nature, the entire world does not know Me, who is transcendental to these modes and inexhaustible.

verses.original:
दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया ।
मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ॥ १४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
daivī hy eṣhā guṇa-mayī mama māyā duratyayā |
mām eva ye prapadyante māyām etāṁ taranti te || 14 ||

translations.english: This divine energy of Mine (**Māyā**), consisting of the three modes of nature, is **difficult to overcome**. But those who **surrender unto Me alone** can easily cross beyond it.

verses.original:
न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः ।
माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः ॥ १५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
na māṁ duṣhkṛtino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ |
māyayāpahṛta-jñānā āsuram bhāvam āśhritāḥ || 15 ||

translations.english: The foolish, those lowest among men, those whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, and those who partake of the demonic nature—these evildoers do not surrender unto Me.

verses.original:
चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन ।
आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ॥ १६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
chatur-vidhā bhajante māṁ janāḥ sukṛtino 'rjuna |
ārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī cha bharatarṣhabha || 16 ||

translations.english: **Four kinds** of virtuous people worship Me, O Arjuna: the **distressed**, the **seeker of knowledge**, the **seeker of wealth**, and the person of **wisdom**.

verses.original:
तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते ।
प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः ॥ १७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
teṣhāṁ jñānī nitya-yukta eka-bhaktir viśiṣhyate |
priyo hi jñānino 'tyartham ahaṁ sa cha mama priyaḥ || 17 ||

translations.english: Among them, the **wise person (jñānī)** who is constantly united with Me and exclusively devoted to Me is the best. I am exceedingly dear to the wise, and he is dear to Me.

verses.original:
उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् ।
आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ॥ १८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tv ātmaiva me matam |
āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā mām evānuttamāṁ gatim || 18 ||

translations.english: All these four types are certainly noble, but I consider the wise one who is united with Me to be **My very Self**. Being steadfast, he is situated on the path leading to Me, the highest goal.

verses.original:
बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते ।
वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः ॥ १९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
bahūnāṁ janmanām ante jñānavān māṁ prapadyate |
vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā su-durlabhaḥ || 19 ||

translations.english: After many births and deaths, he who is actually in knowledge surrenders unto Me, knowing Me to be the cause of all causes and all that is (**Vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti**). Such a great soul (**Mahātmā**) is very rare.

verses.original:
कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः ।
तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया ॥ २० ॥
verses.transliteration:
kāmais tais tair hṛta-jñānāḥ prapadyante 'nya-devatāḥ |
taṁ taṁ niyamam āsthāya prakṛtyā niyatāḥ svayā || 20 ||

translations.english: Those whose minds are distorted by various material desires surrender to **other gods** and follow various rules and regulations of worship, according to their own nature.

verses.original:
यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति ।
तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ॥ २ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yo yo yāṁ yāṁ tanuṁ bhaktaḥ śhraddhayārchitum ichchhati |
tasya tasyāchalāṁ śhraddhāṁ tām eva vidadhāmy aham || 21 ||

translations.english: Whatever form a devotee chooses to worship with faith, **I stabilize the faith** of that devotee in that particular form.

verses.original:
स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते ।
लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ॥ २ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sa tayā śhraddhayā yuktas tasyārādhanam īhate |
labhate cha tataḥ kāmān mayaiva vihitān hi tān || 22 ||

translations.english: Endowed with such faith, the devotee seeks to worship that deity, and obtains the desired benefits, which are in reality **granted by Me alone**.

verses.original:
अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् ।
देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि ॥ २ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
antavat tu phalaṁ teṣhāṁ tad bhavaty alpamedhasām |
devān deva-yajo yānti mad-bhaktā yānti mām api || 23 ||

translations.english: But the fruit gained by those of meager intelligence is **temporary**. Worshippers of the celestial gods go to their planets, but **My devotees come to Me**.

verses.original:
अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः ।
परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् ॥ २४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
avyaktaṁ vyaktim āpannaṁ manyante mām abuddhayaḥ |
paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mamāvyayam anuttamam || 24 ||

translations.english: The unintelligent think that I, the unmanifest, have assumed this manifest form. They do not know My higher, immutable, and supreme nature.

verses.original:
नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः ।
मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ॥ २५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
nāhaṁ prakāśhaḥ sarvasya yoga-māyā-samāvṛtaḥ |
mūḍho 'yaṁ nābhijānāti loko mām ajam avyayam || 25 ||

translations.english: I am not manifest to everyone, being veiled by My internal potency (**Yogamāyā**). The deluded world does not know Me, the unborn and inexhaustible.

verses.original:
वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन ।
भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ॥ २ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
vedāhaṁ samatītāni vartamānāni chārjuna |
bhaviṣhyāṇi cha bhūtāni māṁ tu veda na kaśhchana || 26 ||

translations.english: O Arjuna, **I know all beings**, of the past, present, and future, but no one knows Me.

verses.original:
इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत ।
सर्वभूतानि सम्मोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ॥ २ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ichchhā-dveṣha-samutthena dvandva-mohena bhārata |
sarva-bhūtāni sammohaṁ sarge yānti parantapa || 27 ||

translations.english: O descendant of Bharata, O conqueror of the foe, all living beings are born into delusion, bewildered by the **dualities (like pleasure and pain) arising from desire and hatred**.

verses.original:
येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् ।
ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः ॥ २ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yeṣhāṁ tv anta-gataṁ pāpaṁ janānāṁ puṇya-karmaṇām |
te dvandva-moha-nirmuktā bhajante māṁ dṛḍha-vratāḥ || 28 ||

translations.english: But those persons who have acted virtuously, whose sins have been completely eradicated, become **free from the delusion of dualities** and worship Me with firm resolve.

verses.original:
जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये ।
ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ॥ २ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
jarā-maraṇa-mokṣhāya mām āśhritya yatanti ye |
te brahma tad viduḥ kṛtsnam adhyātmaṁ karma chākhilam || 29 ||

translations.english: Those who strive for liberation from old age and death by **taking refuge in Me**, they understand Brahman (the Absolute), the complete knowledge of the Self (adhyātma), and the entire field of action (karma).

verses.original:
साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः ।
प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः ॥ ३० ॥
verses.transliteration:
sādhibhūtādhidaivaṁ māṁ sādhiyajñaṁ cha ye viduḥ |
prayāṇa-kāle 'pi cha māṁ te vidur yukta-chetasaḥ || 30 ||

translations.english: Those who know Me as the one who controls the material manifestation (adhibhūta), the divine entities (adhidaiva), and the sacrifices (adhiyajña)—they, with steadfast mind, **remember Me even at the time of death**.

chapters.name: Akṣhara Brahma Yoga: The Yoga of the Imperishable Brahman
chapters.summary: Krishna answers Arjuna's seven questions about Brahman, the Self, karma, the material and divine manifestations, and how to remember God at the time of death, emphasizing that the final thought determines the next birth.

verses.original:
अर्जुन उवाच
किं तद् ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम ।
अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते ॥ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
kiṁ tad brahma kim adhyātmaṁ kiṁ karma puruṣhottama |
adhibhūtaṁ cha kiṁ proktam adhidaivaṁ kim uchyate || 1 ||

translations.english: Arjuna said: O Puruṣhottama (Supreme Person), what is that **Brahman**? What is **adhyātma** (the Self)? What is **karma**? What is said to be **adhibhūta** (the material manifestation)? And what is called **adhidaiva** (the divine manifestation)?

verses.original:
अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन ।
प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः ॥ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
adhiyajñaḥ kathaṁ ko 'tra dehe 'smin madhusūdana |
prayāṇa-kāle cha kathaṁ jñeyo 'si niyatātmabhiḥ || 2 ||

translations.english: O Madhusūdana (Krishna), what is **adhiyajña** (the Lord of sacrifice), and how does He reside in the body? And how are You to be known at the **time of death** by those who have controlled their minds?

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते ।
भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः ॥ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
akṣharaṁ brahma paramaṁ svabhāvo 'dhyātmam uchyate |
bhūta-bhāvodbhava-karo visargaḥ karma-saṁjñitaḥ || 3 ||

translations.english: **Brahman** is the indestructible, transcendental living entity (**Akṣhara**). Its eternal nature (svabhāva) is called **adhyātma** (the individual Self). The offering that causes the generation of all beings is called **karma** (action).

verses.original:
अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम् ।
अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर ॥ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
adhibhūtaṁ kṣharo bhāvaḥ puruṣhaśh chādhidaivatam |
adhiyajño 'ham evātra dehe deha-bhṛtāṁ vara || 4 ||

translations.english: **Adhibhūta** (the material manifestation) is My perishable nature. The **Puruṣha** (cosmic form) is **adhidaivata** (the divine manifestation). And O best of embodied beings, **I Myself am Adhiyajña** (Lord of sacrifice) residing within the body.

verses.original:
अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम् ।
यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः ॥ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
anta-kāle cha mām eva smaran muktvā kalevaram |
yaḥ prayāti sa mad-bhāvaṁ yāti nāsty atra saṁśhayaḥ || 5 ||

translations.english: And whoever, at the **time of death**, quits his body **remembering Me alone**, certainly attains My nature (mad-bhāva). There is no doubt about this.

verses.original:
यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम् ।
तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः ॥ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yaṁ yaṁ vāpi smaran bhāvaṁ tyajaty ante kalevaram |
taṁ tam evaiti kaunteya sadā tad-bhāva-bhāvitaḥ || 6 ||

translations.english: O son of Kunti, **whatever state of being one remembers** when he quits his body at the end, that state he attains, being constantly absorbed in that thought.

verses.original:
तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च ।
मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयः ॥ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tasmāt sarveṣhu kāleṣhu mām anusmara yudhya cha |
mayy arpita-mano-buddhir mām evaiṣhyasy asaṁśhayaḥ || 7 ||

translations.english: Therefore, O Arjuna, at **all times remember Me and fight**. With your mind and intellect dedicated to Me, you will certainly attain Me.

verses.original:
अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना ।
परमं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन् ॥ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
abhyāsa-yoga-yuktena chetasā nānya-gāminā |
paramaṁ puruṣhaṁ divyaṁ yāti pārthānuchintayan || 8 ||

translations.english: O Pṛthā's son, one who constantly practices **Yoga**, whose mind is disciplined and does not wander elsewhere, and who meditates on the **Supreme Divine Person**, surely reaches Him.

verses.original:
कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः ।
सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपमादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात् ॥ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
kaviṁ purāṇam anuśhāsitāram aṇor aṇīyāṁsam anusmared yaḥ |
sarvasya dhātāram achintya-rūpam āditya-varṇaṁ tamasaḥ parastāt || 9 ||

translations.english: The one who meditates on the **Omniscient**, the **Ancient**, the **Controller**, minuter than the atom, the **Sustainer** of all, the one whose form is inconceivable, who is effulgent like the sun, and who is beyond the darkness (of ignorance)—

verses.original:
प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव ।
भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम् ॥ १० ॥
verses.transliteration:
prayāṇa-kāle manasāchalena bhaktyā yukto yoga-balena chaiva |
bhruvor madhye prāṇam āveśhya samyak sa taṁ paraṁ puruṣham upaiti divyam || 10 ||

translations.english: —at the time of departure, with a steadfast mind, armed with **devotion** and the power of **Yoga**, perfectly fixing the life-air between the eyebrows, he reaches the Supreme Divine Person.

verses.original:
यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः ।
यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं सङ्ग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये ॥ ११ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yad akṣharaṁ veda-vido vadanti viśhanti yad yatayo vīta-rāgāḥ |
yad ichchhanto brahmacharyaṁ charanti tat te padaṁ saṅgraheṇa pravakṣhye || 11 ||

translations.english: I shall briefly describe to you that goal which the knowers of the Vedas declare to be the **Imperishable**, which ascetics (yatīs) free from attachment enter, and desiring which, they practice celibacy (brahmacharya).

verses.original:
सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च ।
मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम् ॥ १२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-dvārāṇi saṁyamya mano hṛdi nirudhya cha |
mūrdhny ādhāyātmanaḥ prāṇam āsthito yoga-dhāraṇām || 12 ||

translations.english: Controlling all the gates of the body (senses), confining the mind within the heart, fixing the life-air in the head, and situated in the Yoga of concentration.

verses.original:
ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन् ।
यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम् ॥ १३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
om ity ekākṣharaṁ brahma vyāharan mām anusmaran |
yaḥ prayāti tyajan dehaṁ sa yāti paramāṁ gatim || 13 ||

translations.english: One who departs from the body, uttering the single syllable **Om**—the sign of Brahman—and **remembering Me**, attains the supreme destination.

verses.original:
अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः ।
तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः ॥ १४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ananya-chetāḥ satataṁ yo māṁ smarati nityaśhaḥ |
tasyāhaṁ sulabhaḥ pārtha nitya-yuktasya yoginaḥ || 14 ||

translations.english: O Pṛthā's son, **I am easily attainable** by that yogi who constantly remembers Me, whose mind is not diverted to anything else, and who is ever devoted to Me.

verses.original:
मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम् ।
नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः ॥ १५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
mām upetya punar janma duḥkhālayam aśhāśhvatam |
nāpnuvanti mahātmānaḥ saṁsiddhiṁ paramāṁ gatāḥ || 15 ||

translations.english: Having attained Me, the great souls (**Mahātmās**) never again take birth in this temporary world, which is full of miseries, because they have achieved the highest perfection.

verses.original:
आब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन ।
मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते ॥ १६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ābrahma-bhuvanāl lokāḥ punar āvartino 'rjuna |
mām upetya tu kaunteya punar janma na vidyate || 16 ||

translations.english: From the realm of **Brahmā** downward, all worlds are places of **repeated birth and death**, O Arjuna. But one who attains Me, O son of Kunti, never takes birth again.

verses.original:
सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद् ब्रह्मणो विदुः ।
रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः ॥ १७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sahasra-yuga-paryantam ahar yad brahmaṇo viduḥ |
rātriṁ yuga-sahasrāntāṁ te 'ho-rātra-vido janāḥ || 17 ||

translations.english: Those who know that the **day of Brahmā** extends for a **thousand yugas** (ages) and that his night also extends for a thousand yugas—they are the knowers of day and night.

verses.original:
अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे ।
रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके ॥ १८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
avyaktād vyaktayaḥ sarvāḥ prabhavanty ahar-āgame |
rātry-āgame pralīyante tatraivāvyakta-saṁjñake || 18 ||

translations.english: At the advent of Brahmā's day, all manifest beings emerge from the unmanifest (**avyakta**), and at the coming of Brahmā's night, they merge again into that same unmanifest entity.

verses.original:
भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते ।
रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे ॥ १९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
bhūta-grāmaḥ sa evāyaṁ bhūtvā bhūtvā pralīyate |
rātry-āgame 'vaśhaḥ pārtha prabhavaty ahar-āgame || 19 ||

translations.english: This multitude of beings, being helpless, is repeatedly born at the arrival of day, O Pṛthā's son, and is involuntarily dissolved at the arrival of night.

verses.original:
परस्तस्मात्तु भावोऽन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः ।
यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति ॥ २० ॥
verses.transliteration:
paras tasmāt tu bhāvo 'nyo 'vyakto 'vyaktāt sanātanaḥ |
yaḥ sa sarveṣhu bhūteṣhu naśhyatsu na vinaśhyati || 20 ||

translations.english: But beyond this unmanifest (cosmic material nature) there is yet another **unmanifest existence**, which is **eternal** and transcendental. This existence does not perish when all manifested beings perish.

verses.original:
अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम् ।
यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम ॥ २ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
avyakto 'kṣhara ity uktas tam āhuḥ paramāṁ gatim |
yaṁ prāpya na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṁ mama || 21 ||

translations.english: This unmanifest is declared to be the **Imperishable (Akṣhara)**. It is called the **supreme goal**. Having attained it, one never returns to this material world. That is My supreme abode.

verses.original:
पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया ।
यस्यान्तःस्थानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम् ॥ २२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
puruṣhaḥ sa paraḥ pārtha bhaktyā labhyas tv ananyayā |
yasyāntaḥ-sthāni bhūtāni yena sarvam idaṁ tatam || 22 ||

translations.english: That Supreme Person, O son of Pṛthā, is attainable only through **unalloyed devotion (ananyā-bhaktyā)**, within whom all beings reside and by whom this entire universe is pervaded.

verses.original:
यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः ।
प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ ॥ २ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yatra kāle tv anāvṛttim āvṛttiṁ chaiva yoginaḥ |
prayātā yānti taṁ kālaṁ vakṣhyāmi bharatarṣhabha || 23 ||

translations.english: O best of the Bharatas, I shall now describe to you the different **times (paths)** by which yogis depart—some to **return** and some **not to return**.

verses.original:
अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम् ।
तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः ॥ २४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
agnir jyotir ahaḥ śhuklaḥ ṣhaṇ-māsā uttarāyaṇam |
tatra prayātā gachchhanti brahma brahma-vido janāḥ || 24 ||

translations.english: Fire, light, day, the bright fortnight (śhukla), and the six months of the sun's northern path (**Uttarāyaṇam**)—departing by this path, the knowers of Brahman go to **Brahman**.

verses.original:
धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम् ।
तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते ॥ २५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
dhūmo rātris tathā kṛṣhṇaḥ ṣhaṇ-māsā dakṣhiṇāyanam |
tatra chāndramasaṁ jyotir yogī prāpya nivartate || 25 ||

translations.english: Smoke, night, the dark fortnight (kṛṣhṇa), and the six months of the sun's southern path (**Dakṣhiṇāyaṇam**)—departing by this path, the yogi attains the lunar light and **returns** to the mortal world.

verses.original:
शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते ।
एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः ॥ २ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhukla-kṛṣhṇe gatī hy ete jagataḥ śhāśhvate mate |
ekayā yāty anāvṛttim anyayāvartate punaḥ || 26 ||

translations.english: These two paths of **light and darkness** (śhukla and kṛṣhṇa), are considered eternal ways of the world. By one, one goes and **does not return**; by the other, one **returns again**.

verses.verse_number:
नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन ।
तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन ॥ २७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
naite sṛtī pārtha jānan yogī muhyati kaśhchana |
tasmāt sarveṣhu kāleṣhu yoga-yukto bhavārjuna || 27 ||

translations.english: O son of Pṛthā, the yogi who knows these two paths is never bewildered. Therefore, O Arjuna, be steadfastly established in **Yoga at all times**.

verses.original:
वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम् ।
अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम् ॥ २८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
vedeṣhu yajñeṣhu tapaḥsu chaiva dāneṣhu yat puṇya-phalaṁ pradiṣhṭam |
atyeti tat sarvam idaṁ viditvā yogī paraṁ sthānam upaiti chādyam || 28 ||

translations.english: The yogi who understands this truth surpasses the results (rewards) of meritorious actions prescribed in the Vedas, sacrifices, austerities, and charities. He attains the **Supreme, primeval abode**.

chapters.name: Rāja Vidyā Rāja Guhya Yoga: The Yoga of Sovereign Knowledge and Sovereign Secret
chapters.summary: Krishna reveals the most confidential knowledge of His divine glories, explaining how He pervades and sustains the universe without being a part of it, and stressing the importance of pure devotional service (bhakti) as the easiest path to reach Him.

verses.original:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे ।
ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात् ॥ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
śhrī bhagavān uvācha
idaṁ tu te guhyatamaṁ pravakṣhyāmy anasūyave |
jñānaṁ vijñāna-sahitaṁ yaj jñātvā mokṣhyase 'śhubhāt || 1 ||

translations.english: The Supreme Lord said: Since you are not envious, I shall now impart to you this most **confidential knowledge**, together with realization. Knowing this, you will be freed from the miseries of material existence.

verses.original:
राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम् ।
प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम् ॥ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
rāja-vidyā rāja-guhyaṁ pavitram idam uttamam |
pratyakṣhāvagamaṁ dharmyaṁ su-sukhaṁ kartum avyayam || 2 ||

translations.english: This knowledge is the **king of sciences** (**rāja-vidyā**), the **king of secrets** (**rāja-guhyam**), the supreme purifier. It is directly experienced, is in accordance with dharma, is very pleasant to perform, and is eternal.

verses.original:
अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परन्तप ।
अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि ॥ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
aśhraddadhānāḥ puruṣhā dharmasyāsya parantapa |
aprāpya māṁ nivartante mṛtyu-saṁsāra-vartmani || 3 ||

translations.english: Those who have **no faith** in this dharma (path of devotion), O conqueror of the foe (Arjuna), fail to attain Me and return to the path of birth and death in this material world.

verses.original:
मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना ।
मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः ॥ ४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
mayā tatam idaṁ sarvaṁ jagad avyakta-mūrtinā |
mat-sthāni sarva-bhūtāni na chāhaṁ teṣhv avasthitaḥ || 4 ||

translations.english: This entire universe is **pervaded by Me** in My unmanifest form. **All beings are situated in Me**, but I am not situated in them.

verses.original:
न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम् ।
भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः ॥ ५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
na cha mat-sthāni bhūtāni paśhya me yogam aiśhvaram |
bhūta-bhṛn na cha bhūta-stho mamātmā bhūta-bhāvanaḥ || 5 ||

translations.english: And yet, all beings do not rest in Me. Behold My divine mystical power (**yoga-aiśhvaram**)! I am the maintainer of all beings and the creator of all, yet My Self is not situated in them.

verses.original:
यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान् ।
तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय ॥ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yathākāśha-sthito nityaṁ vāyuḥ sarvatra-go mahān |
tathā sarvāṇi bhūtāni mat-sthānīty upadhāraya || 6 ||

translations.english: Understand that just as the mighty wind, moving everywhere, rests always in the space (ether), similarly, **all beings rest in Me**.

verses.original:
सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम् ।
कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम् ॥ ७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-bhūtāni kaunteya prakṛtiṁ yānti māmikām |
kalpa-kṣhaye punas tāni kalpādau visṛjāmy aham || 7 ||

translations.english: O son of Kunti, at the end of a cosmic cycle (**kalpa**), all beings enter My material nature (**prakṛti**), and at the beginning of the next cycle, I create them again.

verses.original:
प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः ।
भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात् ॥ ८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
prakṛtiṁ svām avaṣhṭabhya visṛjāmi punaḥ punaḥ |
bhūta-grāmam imaṁ kṛtsnam avaśhaṁ prakṛter vaśhāt || 8 ||

translations.english: Taking charge of My own material nature, I repeatedly create this entire multitude of beings, which are helpless under the control of nature.

verses.original:
न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय ।
उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु ॥ ९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
na cha māṁ tāni karmāṇi nibadhnanti dhanañjaya |
udāsīna-vad āsīnam asaktaṁ teṣhu karmasu || 9 ||

translations.english: O conqueror of wealth (Arjuna), these actions do not bind Me, because I remain **detached** from them, like one who is neutral.

verses.original:
मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम् ।
हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते ॥ १० ॥
verses.transliteration:
mayādhyakṣheṇa prakṛtiḥ sūyate sa-charācharam |
hetunānena kaunteya jagad viparivartate || 10 ||

translations.english: Under **My supervision**, My material nature (**prakṛti**) generates all moving and non-moving entities. Due to this cause, O son of Kunti, the universe revolves.

verses.original:
अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम् ।
परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम् ॥ ११ ॥
verses.transliteration:
avajānanti māṁ mūḍhā mānuṣhīṁ tanum āśhritam |
paraṁ bhāvam ajānanto mama bhūta-maheśhvaram || 11 ||

translations.english: **Fools deride Me** when I descend in a human form. They do not know My transcendental nature as the Supreme Lord of all creation.

verses.original:
मोघाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः ।
राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः ॥ १२ ॥
verses.transliteration:
moghāśhā mogha-karmāṇo mogha-jñānā vi-chetasaḥ |
rākṣhasīm āsurīṁ chaiva prakṛtiṁ mohinīṁ śhritāḥ || 12 ||

translations.english: Such bewildered persons, holding vain hopes, vain actions, and vain knowledge, possess the deceitful nature of **demons (rākṣhasas)** and **atheists (āsuras)**.

verses.original:
महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः ।
भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम् ॥ १३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
mahātmānas tu māṁ pārtha daivīṁ prakṛtim āśhritāḥ |
bhajanty ananya-manaso jñātvā bhūtādim avyayam || 13 ||

translations.english: O son of Pṛthā, those **great souls (Mahātmās)** who take shelter of My divine nature know Me as the inexhaustible source of all beings and worship Me with **undeviating minds**.

verses.original:
सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्तश्च दृढव्रताः ।
नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते ॥ १४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
satataṁ kīrtayanto māṁ yatantaśh cha dṛḍha-vratāḥ |
namasyantaśh cha māṁ bhaktyā nitya-yuktā upāsate || 14 ||

translations.english: Always **singing My glories**, striving with firm resolve, offering homage, and ever devoted, they worship Me with **loving devotion**.

verses.original:
ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते ।
एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम् ॥ १५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
jñāna-yajñena chāpy anye yajanto mām upāsate |
ekatvena pṛthaktvena bahudhā viśhvato-mukham || 15 ||

translations.english: Others, sacrificing with the **sacrifice of knowledge** (**Jñāna Yajña**), worship Me as the One, as the distinct (Self), and in My manifold cosmic form (Viśhvatomukham).

verses.original:
अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम् ।
मन्त्रोऽहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम् ॥ १६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ahaṁ kratur ahaṁ yajñaḥ svadhāham aham auṣhadham |
mantro 'ham aham evājyam aham agnir ahaṁ hutam || 16 ||

translations.english: **I am** the ritual (kratu), I am the sacrifice (yajña), I am the offering to the ancestors (svadhā), I am the medicinal herb, I am the mantra, I am the clarified butter (ājya), I am the fire, and I am the act of offering.

verses.original:
पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः ।
वेद्यं पवित्रमोङ्कार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च ॥ १७ ॥
verses.transliteration:
pitāham asya jagato mātā dhātā pitāmahaḥ |
vedyaṁ pavitram oṅkāra ṛk sāma yajur eva cha || 17 ||

translations.english: I am the **father** of this universe, the **mother**, the **sustainer**, and the **grandfather**. I am the object of knowledge, the purifier, the syllable **Om**, and also the Ṛg, Sāma, and Yajur Vedas.

verses.original:
गतिर्भर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत् ।
प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम् ॥ १८ ॥
verses.transliteration:
gatir bhartā prabhuḥ sākṣhī nivāsaḥ śharaṇaṁ suhṛt |
prabhavaḥ pralayaḥ sthānaṁ nidhānaṁ bījam avyayam || 18 ||

translations.english: I am the **goal**, the supporter, the Lord, the witness, the abode, the refuge, and the most loving friend. I am the **origin and the dissolution**, the foundation, the treasure-house, and the **imperishable seed**.

verses.original:
तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च ।
अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन ॥ १९ ॥
verses.transliteration:
tapāmy aham ahaṁ varṣhaṁ nigṛhṇāmy utsṛjāmi cha |
amṛtaṁ chaiva mṛtyuśh cha sad asach chāham arjuna || 19 ||

translations.english: I give heat, and I withhold and send forth the rain. I am **immortality** as well as **death**. I am the **manifest (sat)** and the **unmanifest (asat)**, O Arjuna.

verses.original:
त्रैविद्या मां सोमपाः पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते ।
ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोक मश्नन्ति दिव्यान् दिवि देवभोगान् ॥ २० ॥
verses.transliteration:
trai-vidyā māṁ soma-pāḥ pūta-pāpā yajñair iṣhṭvā swarga-gatiṁ prārthayante |
te puṇyam āsādya surendra-lokam aśhnanti divyān divi deva-bhogān || 20 ||

translations.english: Those who study the three Vedas, drink the Soma juice, and purify themselves of sin, worship Me with sacrifices, praying for the path to heaven. Reaching the holy world of the king of gods (Indra), they enjoy celestial pleasures.

verses.original:
ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति ।
एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते ॥ २ १ ॥
verses.transliteration:
te taṁ bhuktvā swarga-lokaṁ viśhālam kṣhīṇe puṇye martya-lokaṁ viśhanti |
evaṁ trayī-dharmam anu-prapannā gatāgataṁ kāma-kāmā labhante || 21 ||

translations.english: Having enjoyed the vast celestial world, they **return to the mortal world** when their accumulated merit (**puṇya**) is exhausted. Thus, those who follow the dharma of the three Vedas, desiring sense pleasures, repeatedly come and go.

verses.original:
अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते ।
तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ॥ २ २ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ananyāśh chintayanto māṁ ye janāḥ paryupāsate |
teṣhāṁ nityābhiyuktānāṁ yoga-kṣhemaṁ vahāmy aham || 22 ||

translations.english: But those who always worship Me with **exclusive devotion** (**ananyāśh**), meditating on My transcendental form—to them, who are constantly united with Me, **I personally carry what they lack and preserve what they have** (**yoga-kṣhemaṁ vahāmy aham**).

verses.original:
येऽप्यन्यदेवता भक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः ।
तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम् ॥ २ ३ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ye 'py anya-devatā bhaktā yajante śhraddhayānvitāḥ |
te 'pi mām eva kaunteya yajanty avidhi-pūrvakam || 23 ||

translations.english: Even those who are devotees of other gods and worship them with faith, they too worship Me, O son of Kunti, but in an improper way.

verses.original:
अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च ।
न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते ॥ २४ ॥
verses.transliteration:
ahaṁ hi sarva-yajñānāṁ bhoktā cha prabhur eva cha |
na tu mām abhijānanti tattvenātaśh chyavanti te || 24 ||

translations.english: I am indeed the **enjoyer and the Lord of all sacrifices**. But those who do not recognize My true transcendental nature fall back (into the cycle of birth and death).

verses.original:
यान्ति देवव्रता देवान्पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः ।
भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम् ॥ २५ ॥
verses.transliteration:
yānti deva-vratā devān pitṝn yānti pitṛ-vratāḥ |
bhūtāni yānti bhūtejyā yānti mad-yājino 'pi mām || 25 ||

translations.english: Those who worship the celestial gods go to the celestial gods; those who worship the ancestors go to the ancestors; those who worship ghosts and spirits go to them; and those who **worship Me come to Me**.

verses.original:
पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति ।
तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः ॥ २ ६ ॥
verses.transliteration:
patraṁ puṣhpaṁ phalaṁ toyaṁ yo me bhaktyā prayachchhati |
tad ahaṁ bhakty-upahṛtam aśhnāmi prayatātmanaḥ || 26 ||
